oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |a!kunta (Stoffel) (I)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A leopard jumps out of a bush and grasps a man's head in its claws. The man slowly returns to his house to lie down and nurse his wounded head. In what seems to be the same story a lion jumps out at a man and bites him, killing him. The lion places the man's body in the shade of a tree. 1) This story is found in Book I.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilhelm Bleek notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Leopards, lions and phrases
